initial_message: I will have the pleasure to give a talk at 3DV 2022.
1 paper accepted at ECCV 2022 on the continuation of our work with MCTS for 3D scene understanding.
1 paper accepted at PAMI on the extension of our ICCV 2022 paper on MCTS for scene understanding.
I am an Area Chair for CVPR'22, ACCV'22, and 3DV'22.
I am the Program Chair for RFIAP 2022.

2 papers accepted at CVPR 2022. One oral presentation on Transformers for 3D Hand and Object pose estimation in complex configurations (and a new 2 hands+object dataset) and 1 on 3D object pose estimation without learning. Congratulations Shreyas and Van Nguyen
1 paper accepted at ICLR 2022 on Hallucinating Visual Correspondences. A very original work IMHO
Hugo successfully defended his PhD, congratulations! And many thanks to the committee: Gabriela Csurka, Ondrej Chum, Krystian Mikolajczyk, Torsten Sattler, and Josef Sivic.
Yuming, together with Yang Xiao and Wen Gao (RobotLearn, Inria), won both tracks 1 and 2 at the Unidentified Video Objects challenge!

2 papers accepted at ICCV 2021. The continuation of our work on MCTS for scene understanding has been accepted for an oral presentation, and our work on object discovery from videos as a poster. Congratulations Sinisa and Yuming!
We received the Best paper award at the CVPR2021 Workshop on Event-based Vision for our paper Detecting Stable Keypoints From Events Through Image Gradient Prediction, congratulations Philippe!
I will be an Area Chair for CVPR 2022.

initial_message: 4 papers accepted at CVPR 2021. Check out our papers on extending MCTS to auto-labelling for 3D scene understanding, on Neural reprojection error for merging feature learning and camera pose estimation, on Single Image Depth Prediction with Wavelet Decomposition (in collaboration with Niantic). Congratulations Shreyas, Sinisa, Hugo, Michael!
1 paper accepted at ACCV 2020, on 3D object pose estimation without training. Congratulations Giorgia!
With my co-authors, I received the Koenderick 'test of time' award at ECCV 2020 for BRIEF! - I am very grateful to the awards committee.
4 papers accepted at ECCV 2020.
2 papers accepted at CVPR 2020.
